toupy.resolution.FSC module¶

FOURIER SHELL CORRELATION modules

class toupy.resolution.FSC.FourierShellCorr(img1, img2, threshold='halfbit', ring_thick=1, apod_width=20)[source]¶

Bases: object

Computes the Fourier Shell Correlation 1 between image1 and image2, and estimate the resolution based on the threshold funcion T of 1 or 1/2 bit.

Parameters

  • img1 (array_like) – Image 1

  • img2 (array_like) – Image 2

  • threshold (str) – The option onebit means 1 bit threshold with SNRt = 0.5, which should be used for two independent measurements. The option halfbit means 1/2 bit threshold with SNRt = 0.2071, which should be use for split tomogram.

  • ring_thick (int) – Thickness of the frequency rings. Normally the pixels get assined to the closest integer pixel ring in Fourier Domain. With ring_thick, each ring gets more pixels and more statistics. The default value is 1.

  • apod_width (int) – Width in pixel of the edges apodization. It applies a Hanning window of the size of the data to the data before the Fourier transform calculations to attenuate the border effects. The default value is 20.

Returns

  • FSC (ndarray) – Fourier Shell correlation curve

  • T (ndarray) – Threshold curve

Note

If 3D images, the first axis is the number of slices, ie., [slices, rows, cols]

References

1

M. van Heel, M. Schatzb, Fourier shell correlation threshold criteria, Journal of Structural Biology 151, 250-262 (2005)

apodization()[source]¶

Compute the Hanning window of the size of the data for the apodization NOTE: It does not depend on the parameter apod_width

circle()[source]¶

Create circle with apodized edges

fouriercorr()[source]¶

Compute FSC and threshold

nyquist()[source]¶

Evaluate the Nyquist Frequency

ringthickness()[source]¶

Define indexes for ring_thick

transverse_apodization()[source]¶

Compute a tapered Hanning-like window of the size of the data for the apodization

class toupy.resolution.FSC.FSCPlot(img1, img2, threshold='halfbit', ring_thick=1, apod_width=20)[source]¶

Bases: toupy.resolution.FSC.FourierShellCorr

Upper level object to plot the FSC and threshold curves

Parameters

  • img1 (ndarray) – Image 1

  • img2 (ndarray) – Image 2

  • threshold (str) – Threshold options: - onebit: 1 bit threshold -> SNRt = 0.5 (for two independent measurements) - halfbit: 1/2 bit threshold -> SNRt = 0.2071 (for split tomogram)

  • ring_thick (int (default 1)) – Thickness of the frequency rings. Normally the pixels get assined to the closest integer pixel ring in Fourier Domain. With ring_thick, each ring gets more pixels and more statistics.

  • apod_width (int (default 20)) – Width in pixel of the edges apodization. It applies a Hanning window of the size of the data to the data before the Fourier transform calculations to attenuate the border effects.

Returns

  • fn (ndarray) – Frequencies normalized by the Nyquist frequency

  • FSC (ndarray) – Fourier Shell correlation curve

  • T (ndarray) – Threshold curve
